  • Constructor Details

    • Configuration

      public Configuration()
      Configuration Constructor - default

    • Configuration

      public Configuration​(double stepsPerSecond, int stepsNumber, Mode mode, int gridWidth, int gridHeight)
      Overloading Configuration Constructor - full
      Parameters:
      stepsPerSecond - the number of steps per second for the simulation
      stepsNumber - the number of steps for the simulation
      mode - the simulation's mode to run (forest -- default, insect, fire)
      gridWidth - how many Cells width is the grid
      gridHeight - how many Cells height is the grid

  • Method Details

    • getStepsPerSecond

      public double getStepsPerSecond()

    • setStepsPerSecond

      public void setStepsPerSecond​(double stepsPerSecond)
      stepsPerSecond should always be at least 1 to properly run the simulation
      Parameters:
      stepsPerSecond - the number of steps per second for the simulation
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of steps per second is inferior or equal to 0

    • getStepsNumber

      public int getStepsNumber()

    • setStepsNumber

      public void setStepsNumber​(int stepNumber)
      stepNumber should always be at least 1 to properly run a simulation
      Parameters:
      stepNumber - the number of steps for the simulation
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number or steps is inferior to 1

    • getMode

      public Mode getMode()

    • setMode

      public void setMode​(Mode mode)

    • getGridWidth

      public int getGridWidth()

    • setGridWidth

      public void setGridWidth​(int gridWidth)
      The user has to draw a minimum of 5 cells to run a simulation ; therefore, the grid must be at least 2x3 or 3x2
      Parameters:
      gridWidth - how many Cells width is the grid
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width is inferior to 2

    • getGridHeight

      public int getGridHeight()

    • setGridHeight

      public void setGridHeight​(int gridHeight)
      The user has to draw a minimum of 5 cells to run a simulation ; therefore, the grid must be at least 2x3 or 3x2
      Parameters:
      gridHeight - how many Cells height is the grid
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the height is inferior to 2
